required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Efficacy and Safety of Olmesartan Medoxomil in Children and Adolescent Patients With High Blood Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: Dose-ranging Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Olmesartan Medoxomil in Children and Adolescents With Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: This study assesses the efficacy and safety of olmesartan medoxomil in children ages 1-16 with high blood pressure. After a 5-week blinded treatment period of up to 5 weeks participants can continue to take olmesartan medoxomil (OM) for up to an additional 46 weeks.

detailed_description.textblock:
This was a randomized, multicenter, double-blind, parallel-group, prospective dose-ranging study in subjects 1 to 16 years of age with hypertension. Subjects were enrolled into 1 of 3 cohorts based on age and race. Subjects 6 to 16 years of age were enrolled into Cohort A. Subjects enrolled into Cohort A were stratified by age with approximately half aged 6 to 12 years and the remainder aged 13 to 16 years. Approximately 15% of the subjects in Cohort A were to be Black or of African descent. When a minimum of 28 Black subjects were randomized into Cohort A, enrollment in Cohort B was started. Black subjects only, 6 to 16 years of age, were enrolled into Cohort B. For Cohorts A and B body weight of any patient was >=20Kg. Seated systolic blood pressure (SeSBP) was >=95th percentile for gender and height-for-age, or >=90th percentile if the patient is diabetic, or has glomerular kidney disease, or has a family history of hypertension. Patients with symptomatic hypertension requiring immediate established therapy, or who are above 2 standard deviations (SD) above the 99th percentile did not participate in the study.
Subjects 1 to 5 years of age were enrolled into Cohort C regardless of race. Body weight of any patient was >=5Kg. SeSBP was >=95th percentile for gender and height-for-age, or >=90th percentile if the patient is diabetic, or has glomerular kidney disease, or has a family history of hypertension. Patients on stable doses of concomitant antihypertensive agents including calcium channel blockers and/or diuretics only are permitted to enroll. Patients with symptomatic hypertension requiring immediate established therapy, or who are above 2 SD above the 99th percentile did not participate in the study.
The study comprised four periods. Period I was a wash-out period from Week -1 to randomization. Subjects were randomized to treatment sequences carried through the remainder of the study. Period II was a three-week, double-blind, dose-ranging period for Cohorts A and B, beginning at Day 1 and ending at the end of Week 3. In Cohorts A and B, subjects received either low-dose or high-dose olmesartan (OM) once daily. In Cohort C, Period II was an open-label OM treatment period where all subjects received 0.3 mg/kg OM per day. Period III was a double-blind, placebo-controlled withdrawal period beginning at Week 4 and ending after 1 or 2 weeks, depending on the seated blood pressure measurement at each weekly study visit. Subjects either continued their Period II OM regimen or switched to placebo based on the initial randomization scheme. Period IV was a 46-week open-label extension period.

primary_outcome.measure: Least Squares Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic Blood Pressure to the End of Period 2 (3 Weeks)
primary_outcome.description: The efficacy dose response change in trough seated systolic blood pressure (both non-weight adjusted and weight adjusted results) from baseline to the end of the dose-ranging period (Period 2). Non-weight adjusted dose was the fixed olmesartan medoxomil dose; weight adjusted dose calculated mg of olmesartan medoxomil per kg of weight at baseline.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 2 (3 Weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the dose ranging period in systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Period 3 Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 3 (period 3 baseline) to week 5 (end of Period 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from period 3 baseline (completion of the dose adjustment period and prior to starting the treatment of period 3) to the end of period 3 (double-blind placebo-controlled period) in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Period 3 Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 3
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 3 (period 3 baseline) to week 5 (end of Period 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from period 3 baseline (completion of the dose adjustment period and prior to starting the treatment of period 3) to the end of period 3 (double-blind placebo-controlled period) in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort C.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 4 (End of Study)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the open label Period 4 in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 4 (End of Study)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 to week 51 week (end of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the open label Period 4 in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort C.

arm_group.description: For Cohorts A and B, olmesartan medoxomil suspension 2.5 mg to 40 mg in patients 6-16 years old, depending on weight. For Cohort C, olmesartan medoxomil suspension 0.3 mg/kg to in patients 1-5 years old.
Cohorts A, B, C - olmesartan medoxomil suspension or placebo taken once daily. Olmesartan medoxomil dose continued as in previous period.
Cohorts A and B: Open label olmesartan medoxomil suspension or tablets 10mg - 40 mg Cohort C: Open label olmesartan medoxomil suspension 0.3 mg/kg - 0.6 mg/kg

intervention.description: Cohorts A and B: 2.5mg to 40mg olmesartan, as a suspension (depending on weight), once daily. Tablets were used to prepare a suspension. Cohort C: 0.3mg/kg olmesartan ,as a suspension, once daily
Cohorts A, B, C: placebo, once daily

Cohorts A and B: Open label olmesartan medoxomil suspension or tablets 10mg - 40 mg. Tablets were used to prepare the suspension or were given directly. Cohort C: Open label olmesartan medoxomil suspension 0.3 mg/kg - 0.6 mg/kg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient's seated systolic BP (SeSBP) will be greater than or equal to 95th percentile for gender and height-for- age, or greater than or equal to 90th percentile if the patient is diabetic, or has glomerular kidney disease, or has a family history of hypertension.
- Negative for hepatitis B and C
- Negative for HIV
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient should not have serious other conditions that could interfere with the analysis of the results or that could interfere with the well-being of the patient in the trial.
- Known sensitivity to olmesartan medoxomil
- Taking prohibited medication
- Consumed greater than 180 mg of caffeine daily
- Malignant hypertension
- History of congestive heart failure, cardiomyopathy, or obstructive valve disease
- Renal transplant within the previous 6 months
- Severe nephritic syndrome not in remission

clinical_study.keyword: Treatment of hypertension or high blood pressure in children ages 1-16 years.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Period 1 was a screening, wash-out period of approximately two weeks. All participants were included in the screening, wash-out period and during this period no intervention was administered.

group.title: Cohort A: High Dose OM in Periods 2, 3
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) given a high dose (20 mg or 40 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period from day 0 to week 3). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period from week 3 to week 5).

group.title: Cohort A: Low Dose OM in Periods 2, 3
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) given a low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period from day 0 to week 3). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period from week 3 to week 5).

group.title: Cohort A: Placebo in Period 3 (From High Dose in Period 2)
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) given placebo during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period from week 3 to week 5) instead of the previous high dose of olmesartan

group.title: Cohort A: Placebo in Period 3 (From Low Dose in Period 2)
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) given placebo during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period from week 3 to week 5) instead of the previous low dose of olmesartan.

group.title: Cohort A: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: All members of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) were given 10 mg to 40 mg of olmesartan (OM) administered as oral suspension or tablets depending on participant weight and response in the open-label Period 4 (weeks 6-51). Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Cohort B: High Dose OM in Periods 2, 3
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) given a high dose (20 mg or 40 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period from day 0 to week 3). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period from week 3 to week 5).

group.title: Cohort B: Low Dose OM in Periods 2, 3
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) given a low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period from day 0 to week 3). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period from week 3 to week 5).

group.title: Cohort B: Placebo in Period 3 (From High Dose in Period 2)
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) given placebo during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period from week 3 to week 5) instead of the previous high dose of olmesartan.

group.title: Cohort B: Placebo in Period 3 (From Low Dose in Period 2)
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) given placebo during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period from week 3 to week 5) instead of the previous low dose of olmesartan.

group.title: Cohort B: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: All members of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) were given 10 mg to 40 mg of olmesartan (OM) administered as oral suspension or tablets depending on participant weight and response in the open-label Period 4 (weeks 6-51). Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Cohort C: OM in Periods 2, 3, 4
group.description: Cohort C (1-5 years old) was given olmesartan medoxomil (OM) 0.3 mg/kg in Period 2 (open-label period from day 0 to week 3) and a subgroup of Cohort C was given that dose of OM during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period from week 3 to week 5). In Period 4 (open-label period from weeks 6-51), all of Cohort C received an OM starting dose of 0.3 mg/kg. If hypertension was not controlled after two week the dose was doubled. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Cohort C: Placebo in Period 3 (From OM in Period 2)
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort C (1-5 years old) given placebo during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period from week 3 to week 5).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: The blood pressure goal was met

group.title: Cohort A: High Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) given a high dose (20 mg or 40 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

group.title: Cohort A: Low Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) given a low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

group.title: Cohort B: High Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) given a high dose (20 mg or 40 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

group.title: Cohort B: Low Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) given a low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

group.title: Cohort C: OM (Olmesartan Medoxomil)
group.description: Cohort C (1-5 years old) was given olmesartan medoxomil (OM) 0.3 mg/kg in Period 2 (open-label period) and a subgroup of Cohort C was given that dose of OM during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period). In Period 4 (open-label period), all of Cohort C received an OM starting dose of 0.3 mg/kg. If hypertension was not controlled after two week the dose was doubled. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: The data provided for the total study population includes only Cohorts A+B.

measure.title: Height
measure.description: The data provided for the total study population is only for Cohorts A+B

measure.title: Seated Systolic blood pressure
measure.description: The data provided for the total study population is only for Cohort A+B

measure.title: Seated diastolic blood pressure
measure.description: The data provided for the total study population consists only of Cohort A+B

measure.title: Weight
measure.description: The data provided for the total study population is only for Cohort A+B

outcome.title: Least Squares Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic Blood Pressure to the End of Period 2 (3 Weeks)
outcome.description: The efficacy dose response change in trough seated systolic blood pressure (both non-weight adjusted and weight adjusted results) from baseline to the end of the dose-ranging period (Period 2). Non-weight adjusted dose was the fixed olmesartan medoxomil dose; weight adjusted dose calculated mg of olmesartan medoxomil per kg of weight at baseline.
outcome.population: The number of participants includes all randomized to Cohort A, Cohort B and a combination of the two cohorts. The Last Observation Carried Forward method was used in the linear regression analysis for the change in the seated systolic blood pressure from baseline to the end of three weeks.

group.title: Cohort A
group.description: Cohort A participants were 6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants. Includes participants randomized to both the high dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (20 mg or 40 mg) and the low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0mg), depending on weight, administered once daily.

group.title: Cohort B
group.description: Cohort B participants were 6-16 years old and comprised exclusively of Black participants. Includes participants randomized to both the high dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (20 mg or 40 mg) and the low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0 mg), depending on weight, administered once daily.

group.title: Cohorts A + B
group.description: Cohort A + B participants were 6-16 years old. Cohort A limited the number of Black participants, while Cohort B was comprised exclusively of Black participants. Includes participants randomized to both the high dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (20 mg or 40 mg) and the low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0mg), depending on weight, administered once daily.

measure.title: Least Squares Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic Blood Pressure to the End of Period 2 (3 Weeks)
measure.description: The efficacy dose response change in trough seated systolic blood pressure (both non-weight adjusted and weight adjusted results) from baseline to the end of the dose-ranging period (Period 2). Non-weight adjusted dose was the fixed olmesartan medoxomil dose; weight adjusted dose calculated mg of olmesartan medoxomil per kg of weight at baseline.
measure.population: The number of participants includes all randomized to Cohort A, Cohort B and a combination of the two cohorts. The Last Observation Carried Forward method was used in the linear regression analysis for the change in the seated systolic blood pressure from baseline to the end of three weeks.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 2 (3 Weeks)
outcome.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the dose ranging period in systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.
outcome.population: The Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population for Period II of the study was defined as subjects who took at least one dose of study medication and had study baseline and at least one seated systolic, or diastolic blood pressure measurement after taking study medication. The Last Observation carried forward was used

group.title: Cohort A: Low Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) given a low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

group.title: Cohort B: Low Dose OM

Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

group.title: Cohort B: High Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) given a high dose (20 mg or 40 mg) of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) depending on weight during Period 2 (double-blind, dose-response period). Half of the participants continued this dose into Period 3 (double-blind, placebo controlled period).

group.title: Cohorts A + B: Low Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup from Cohorts A + B (6-16 years old) who received the low dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM 2.5 mg or 5.0 mg depending on weight), administered once daily in Period 2. Cohort A limited the number of Black participants, while Cohort B was comprised exclusively of Black participants.

group.title: Cohorts A + B: High Dose OM
group.description: Subgroup from Cohorts A + B (6-16 years old) who received the high dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM 20 mg or 40 mg depending on weight), administered once daily in Period 2. Cohort A limited the number of Black participants, while Cohort B was comprised exclusively of Black participants.

measure.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the dose ranging period in systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.

The Last Observation carried forward was used

analysis.groups_desc: A linear regression analysis of olmesartan dose (non-weight adjusted) on the change from baseline in seated systolic blood pressure was carried out. The null hypothesis of zero-slope was tested.
A linear regression analysis of olmesartan dose (non-weight adjusted) on the change from baseline in seated diastolic blood pressure was carried out. The null hypothesis of zero-slope was tested.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Period 3 Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 3
outcome.description: Mean change from period 3 baseline (completion of the dose adjustment period and prior to starting the treatment of period 3) to the end of period 3 (double-blind placebo-controlled period) in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.
outcome.time_frame: Week 3 (period 3 baseline) to week 5 (end of Period 3)
outcome.population: Intent to treat population defined as subjects who finished Period 2, had the end of Period 2 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement, took the Period 3 study medication for at least one week, and had the end of Period 3 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement.

group.title: Cohort A: OM Period 3
group.description: Cohort A participants were 6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants. Includes participants randomized to both the high dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM 20 mg or 40 mg) and the low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0mg), depending on weight, administered once daily in period 2, and continued that dosage into period 3.

group.title: Cohort A: Placebo Period 3
group.description: Cohort A participants were 6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants. Includes participants randomized to both the high and low dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension in period 2, and changed to placebo in period 3.

group.title: Cohort B: OM Period 3
group.description: Cohort B participants were 6-16 years old and comprised exclusively of Black participants. Includes participants randomized to both the high dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM 20 mg or 40 mg) and the low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0mg), depending on weight, administered once daily in period 2, and continued that dosage into period 3.

group.title: Cohort B: Placebo Period 3
group.description: Cohort B participants were 6-16 years old and comprised exclusively of Black participants. Includes participants randomized to both the high and low dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension in period 2, and changed to placebo in period 3.

group.title: Cohorts A + B: OM Period 3
group.description: Cohort A + B participants were 6-16 years old. Includes participants randomized to both the high dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM 20 mg or 40 mg) and the low dose (2.5 mg or 5.0mg), depending on weight, administered once daily in period 2, and continued that dosage into period 3.

group.title: Cohorts A + B: Placebo Period 3
group.description: Cohorts A + B participants were 6-16 years old. Includes participants randomized to both the high and low dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension in period 2, and changed to placebo in period 3.

measure.title: Mean Change From Period 3 Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 3
measure.description: Mean change from period 3 baseline (completion of the dose adjustment period and prior to starting the treatment of period 3) to the end of period 3 (double-blind placebo-controlled period) in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.
measure.population: Intent to treat population defined as subjects who finished Period 2, had the end of Period 2 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement, took the Period 3 study medication for at least one week, and had the end of Period 3 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of systolic blood pressure. Null hypothesis of no treatment difference was tested.
analysis.method_desc: The ANCOVA model used treatment and country as fixed effects and baseline as covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis for diastolic blood pressure. The null hypothesis of no treatment difference was tested.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Period 3 Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 3
outcome.description: Mean change from period 3 baseline (completion of the dose adjustment period and prior to starting the treatment of period 3) to the end of period 3 (double-blind placebo-controlled period) in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort C.
outcome.time_frame: Week 3 (period 3 baseline) to week 5 (end of Period 3)
outcome.population: Intent to treat population defined as subjects who finished Period 2, had the end of Period 2 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement, took the Period 3 study medication for at least one week, and had the end of Period 3 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement.

group.title: Cohort C: OM Period 3
group.description: Cohort C consisted of children from 1 to 5 years of age. There were no racial restrictions. This group continued on its Period 2 olmesartan dose of 0.3 mg/kg.

group.title: Cohort C: Placebo Period 3
group.description: Cohort C consisted of children from 1 to 5 years of age. There were no racial restrictions. This group was switched from its Period 2 olmesartan dose of 0.3 mg/kg to placebo.

measure.title: Mean Change From Period 3 Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 3
measure.description: Mean change from period 3 baseline (completion of the dose adjustment period and prior to starting the treatment of period 3) to the end of period 3 (double-blind placebo-controlled period) in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort C.
measure.population: Intent to treat population defined as subjects who finished Period 2, had the end of Period 2 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement, took the Period 3 study medication for at least one week, and had the end of Period 3 seated systolic or diastolic blood pressure measurement.

analysis.groups_desc: For seated systolic blood pressure the null hypothesis of no treatment difference was tested.
analysis.method_desc: The ANCOVA model used treatment and country as fixed effects and baseline as covariate.

analysis.groups_desc: For seated diastolic blood pressure the null hypothesis of no treatment difference was tested.
analysis.method_desc: The ANCOVA model used treatment and country as fixed effects and baseline as covariate.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 4 (End of Study)
outcome.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the open label Period 4 in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.
outcome.population: Intent to treat population includes participants with at least one visit in Period 4.

group.title: Cohort A: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: All members of Cohort A (6-16 years old with a limit on the number of Black participants) were given 10 mg to 40 mg of olmesartan (OM) administered as oral suspension or tablets depending on participant weight and response in the open-label Period 4. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Cohort B: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: All members of Cohort B (6-16 years old comprised exclusively of Black participants) were given 10 mg to 40 mg of olmesartan (OM) administered as oral suspension or tablets depending on participant weight and response in the open-label Period 4. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Cohorts A + B: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: All members of Cohorts A + B (6-16 years old) were given 10 mg to 40 mg of olmesartan (OM) administered as oral suspension or tablets depending on participant weight and response in the open-label Period 4. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 4 (End of Study)
measure.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the open label Period 4 in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort A, Cohort B and Cohorts A+B combined.
measure.population: Intent to treat population includes participants with at least one visit in Period 4.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 4 (End of Study)
outcome.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the open label Period 4 in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort C.
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 to week 51 week (end of study)
outcome.population: 57=the number of participants who received medication in Period 4

group.title: Cohort C: OM (Olmesartan Medoxomil)
group.description: Cohort C (1-5 years old) was given olmesartan medoxomil (OM) 0.3 mg/kg in Period 2 (open-label period) and a subgroup of Cohort C was given that dose of OM during Period 3 (double-blind, placebo-controlled period). In Period 4 (open-label period), all of Cohort C received an OM starting dose of 0.3 mg/kg. If hypertension was not controlled after two week the dose was doubled. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Seated Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure Measurements to the End of Period 4 (End of Study)
measure.description: Mean change from baseline to the end of the open label Period 4 in seated systolic and diastolic blood pressure readings for Cohort C.
measure.population: 57=the number of participants who received medication in Period 4

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected starting with the signing of the informed consent form and continuing through the end of the study (51 weeks)
reported_events.desc: AEs observed by the investigator, or reported by the subject, and any remedial action taken, were recorded in the case report form by the investigator. The nature of each event, time of onset after drug administration, duration, and intensity were documented together with the investigators opinion of the causal relationship to the treatment.

group.title: Cohort A: Period 2 High Dose OM
group.description: For Cohort A (participants 6-16 years old), olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) providing 20 mg or 40 mg, depending on weight.

group.title: Cohort A: Period 2 Low Dose OM
group.description: For Cohort A (participants 6-16 years old), olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) providing 2.5 mg or 5 mg, depending on weight.

group.title: Cohort A: Period 3 OM High Dose Continued
group.description: The 20 mg or 40 mg dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) from the previous period was continued.

group.title: Cohort A: Period 3 Placebo From High Dose
group.description: Placebo was given instead of the previous high dose of olmesartan

group.title: Cohort A: Period 3 OM Low Dose Continued
group.description: The 2.5 mg or 5 mg dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) from the previous period was continued.

group.title: Cohort A: Period 3 Placebo From Low Dose
group.description: Placebo was given instead of the previous low dose of olmesartan

group.title: Cohort A: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: 10 mg to 40 mg of olmesartan (OM) was administered as oral suspension or tablets depending on participant weight and response. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Cohort B: Period 2 High Dose OM
group.description: For Cohort A (participants 6-16 years old), olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) providing 20 mg or 40 mg, depending on weight.

group.title: Cohort B: Period 2 Low Dose OM
group.description: For Cohort B (participants 6-16 years old), olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) providing 2.5 mg or 5 mg, depending on weight.

group.title: Cohort B: Period 3 OM High Dose Continued
group.description: The 20 mg or 40 mg dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) from the previous period was continued.

group.title: Cohort B: Period 3 Placebo From High Dose
group.description: Placebo was given instead of the previous high dose of olmesartan

group.title: Cohort B: Period 3 OM Low Dose Continued
group.description: The 2.5 mg or 5 mg dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) from the previous period was continued.

group.title: Cohort B: Period 3 Placebo From Low Dose
group.description: Placebo was given instead of the previous low dose of olmesartan

group.title: Cohort B: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: 10 mg to 40 mg of olmesartan (OM) was administered as oral suspension or tablets depending on particpant weight and response. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

group.title: Cohort C: Period 2 Open-label OM
group.description: The dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) was 0.3 mg/kg for all particpants who were 1 to 5 years of age.

group.title: Cohort C: Period 3 OM Dose Continued
group.description: The 0.3 mg/kg dose of OM was continued for these participants

group.title: Cohort C: Period 3 Placebo
group.description: The 0.3 mg/kg dose of olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) was discontinued for these participants. They were switched to placebo.

group.title: Cohort C: Period 4 Open-label OM
group.description: Participants received an olmesartan medoxomil suspension (OM) starting dose of 0.3 mg/kg. If hypertension was not controlled after two week the dose was doubled. Additional antihypertensive drugs (not an angiotensin converting enzyme or angiotensin receptor blocker) were allowed if hypertension was not controlled.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If identified by Daiichi Sankyo Inc.(DSI), any of DSI's confidential information, as defined to the author, shall be deleted. Nothing in our site agreement shall be taken as giving DSI any right of editorial control over any publication prepared by the study site.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Howard Kessler, Senior Director Regulatory Operations
